text_blocks.snippet: An NFL game is a professional American football game played as part of the National Football League (NFL). The NFL is the highest level of professional American football in the United States. These games involve two teams of 11 players competing on a 100-yard field, aiming to score points by advancing the ball into the opponent's end zone.

list.title: Key aspects of an NFL game:

snippets.Teams and Players: Each NFL team has 53 players on its roster, with offensive, defensive, and special teams units taking turns on the field.
snippets.Scoring: The primary way to score is by reaching the end zone for a touchdown, worth 6 points. Extra points are typically attempted after a touchdown.
snippets.Downs:: Teams have four downs (plays) to advance the ball at least 10 yards. If successful, they get another set of four downs. If they fail, possession changes.
snippets.Passing and Running: Teams can move the ball by passing it through the air or by running with it.
snippets.Times: A standard NFL game is 60 minutes long, divided into four 15-minute quarters.
snippets.Entertainment: NFL games are a major form of entertainment, with a large and passionate fan base.
snippets.Competition: The NFL is highly competitive, with 32 teams vying for a chance to reach the Super Bowl.
